hospital.model

Class EmergencyRoomLog

  • java.lang.Object
    • hospital.model.EmergencyRoomLog
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class EmergencyRoomLog
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class stores log information about Patients served by the Emergency Room doctors. The log maintains state information about the current time in the hospital and records timestamped patient activity. This class also provides methods to compute performance data about the ER's wait times and overall compliance with hospital-policy thresholds.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • EmergencyRoomLog

        public EmergencyRoomLog()
        Creates an empty ER Log. The log will initialize the ER clock to 0.

    • Method Detail

      • getERClock

        public int getERClock()
        Retrieves the current ER clock time, in minutes.
        Returns:
        The current time in the ER.

      • incrementERClock

        public void incrementERClock()
        Increments the ER clock by one minute.

      • treatPatient

        public void treatPatient(Patient thePatient,
                         java.lang.String seenBy)
        Enters a Patient into the EmergencyRoomLog when they have left the WaitingRoom. This method records the patient seen, the doctor that saw them, and internally records the time when this patient was seen based on the current ER clock time.
        Parameters:
        thePatient - The Patient being seen by the physician.
        seenBy - The name of the physician treating the Patient in "Last, First" format.

      • numPatientsSeenBy

        public int numPatientsSeenBy(java.lang.String treatingPhysician)
        Retrieves the number of patients seen by a given physician since this EmergencyRoomLog was created.
        Parameters:
        treatingPhysician - The name of the doctor of interest in "Last, First" format.
        Returns:
        The total number of patients seen so far by the treatingPhysican in the log. Physicians are identified in a case sensitive manner.

        When null is specified as the treatingPhysician the total number of patients seen by all doctors will be returned.

      • numPatientsSeen

        public int numPatientsSeen(int priority)
        Retrieves the number of patients seen at a given priority level.
        Parameters:
        priority - The priority on which to filter results. If 0 the total will be for all patients seen. Priorities of 1-5 will retrieve the total for only patients with conditions matching the specified provided priority.
        Returns:
        The number of patients seen at the specified priority.
        Throws:
        EmptyLogException - when no data is present in the ER Log.
        InvalidPriorityException - when the specified priority is outside the range 0-5, inclusive

      • getAverageWaitTime

        public double getAverageWaitTime(int priority)
        Retrieves the average wait time patients seen thus far since opening the EmergencyRoomLog. The data may be optionally filtered based on the triage priority level.

        Note: Patients still in a WaitingRoom do not factor into the these statistics.

        Parameters:
        priority - The priority on which to filter results. If 0 the average will be for all patients seen. Priorities of 1-5 will retrieve the average for only patients with conditions matching the specified provided priority.
        Returns:
        The average wait time for the data specified.
        Throws:
        EmptyLogException - when no data is present in the ER Log.
        InvalidPriorityException - when the specified priority is outside the range 0-5, inclusive

      • numPatientsOverThreshold

        public int numPatientsOverThreshold(int priority)
        Computes the number of patients in the EmergencyRoomLog whose total wait time prior to being seen exceeds the hospital specified thresholds for their priority level.
        Parameters:
        priority - The priority level of interest (1-5, inclusive)
        Returns:
        The total number of patients who waited more than the number of minutes specified by the hospital's response threshold.
        Throws:
        EmptyLogException - when no data is present in the ER Log.
        InvalidPriorityException - when the specified priority is outside the range 1-5, inclusive
